result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adrian J Guerrero

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Transcript GUILTY PLEA & SENTENCING, commencing MAY 12, 2016, received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 15CF4359 (30 Pages).

Defendant Adrian J Guerrero in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Adrian J Guerrero in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in.

Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court, defendant Adrian J Guerrero not in court, in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel advised the Court that Judge Wagner, Branch 38 has agreed to accept this case as part of a global resolution.  Court ordered case transferred to Judge Wagner, Branch 38 for plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court, defendant Adrian J Guerrero not in court, in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant has a speedy trial demand on a pending felony before Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  This Court has no objection to this case being resolved before Judge Wagner, Branch 38 as part of a global resolution.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  All parties are notified that effective March 14, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Michael Hanrahan - Branch 4 in Room 622 - Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court, defendant Adrian J Guerrero not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Global resolution is no longer valid.  All misdemeanor cases are to be sent back to misdemeanor court to Branch 4 in keeping with assigned calendar.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court, defendant Adrian J Guerrero not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel is requesting an adjournment of the plea hearing as he has been in trial and unable to meet with defendant to complete paperwork.  Court will grant adjournment to 3-3-2016 at 8:15 for plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court, defendant Adrian J Guerrero not in court, in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel advised the court that Judge Wagner, Branch 38 has agreed to accept this case as part of a global resolution.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 38.

Atty Scott Anderson is requesting that defendant's pending misdemeanors, 15CM1491 and 15CM1990, be transferred to BRANCH 38 for global resolution.  Court will accept those cases.  Cases set for plea on 2-23-2016.

Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court, defendant Adrian J Guerrero not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel continues to work on resolving this case with the pending felonies.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court, defendant Adrian J Guerrero not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant has a pending felony before Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  This court has no objection to this case being transferred as part of a global resolution.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adrian J Guerrero in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Defendant Adrian J Guerrero in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
ATTORNEY'S MOTION TO WITHDRAW.  Received and Filed.

Attorney James Robert Daniel Rael in court, defendant Adrian J Guerrero not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse. Case adjourned to branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adrian J Guerrero in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Defendant Adrian J Guerrero in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. This matter was transferred from Branch 24 for purposes of a global resolution. Parties have not reached a resolution in this matter. State placed offer on the record, which the defendant rejected. State's offer is WITHDRAWN. Court ordered this matter transferred back to Branch 24. Defendant's request for new counsel denied by the court. Case adjourned to Branch 24.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney James D. Rael in court, defendant Adrian J Guerrero not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel advised the court that the defendant has pending felonies before Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  This clerk confirmed with the clerk in Branch 25 that this case can be transferred as part of a global resolution.  Court ordered case transferred to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney James D. Rael in court, defendant Adrian J Guerrero not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant has a new pending felony matter.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney James D. Rael in court, defendant Adrian J Guerrero not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant has a felony pending in Branch 25.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
from WCS advising that the defendant has been discharged from pretrial services.

Attorney James D. Rael in court, defendant Adrian J Guerrero not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the Milwaukee, County of. CMC. For reasons placed on the record, defense requests a Status Conference. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, WCS Report.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, Defendant Adrian J Guerrero not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant not produced from the Criminal Justice Facility for purposes of this hearing. Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court. Attorney James D. Rael will be handling this case.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court earlier, defendant Adrian J Guerrero not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant has new charges pending.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 24.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

15RM036278  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08/03/2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Defendant  to be monitored by drug tests, portable breathalyzers and SCRAM
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adrian J Guerrero in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial conference conducted.  Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Adrian J Guerrero in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Adrian J Guerrero in custody.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.
